page.title: 07Farming_sheep.
page.content: The lambs are kept outdoors until October/November time when they are then about seven months old.It is at that time that they are taken to market on the Plain where they are sold for slaughter.Each year a few of the young females are kept back and older ones are sold in their place.In this way the farmer is constantly renewing his flock and keeping it strong and healthy.When the lambs are newly born they are prone to predation from foxes and from crows.The crows especially are a real menace as they will peck at the lamb's eyes and also at the umbilical cord still attached to its stomach.Constant pecking and pulling at the cord gradually pulls the whole of the lamb's stomach and intestines out and of course destroys the animal.
